channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A two-run lead was starting to slip away from the Los Angeles Dodgers in the ninth inning — along with their chance to force the World Series to Game 7.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Giddey, Vucevic lead Bulls past Knicks 135-125 and a 5-0 start
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Josh Giddey scored a career-high 32 points with 10 rebounds and nine assists, Nikola Vucevic added 26 points, and the Chicago Bulls beat the New York Knicks 135-125 on Friday night to stay undefeated and get out to their best start in nearly three decades.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps: 'We are trying our hardest' to settle antitrust lawsuit
item.description: AVONDALE, Ariz. (AP) — NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps said Friday “we are trying our hardest” to settle the federal antitrust lawsuit with the two teams suing the racing series in the most expansive comments yet from the defendants.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: NFL fines the Baltimore Ravens $100,000 over the inaccurate injury report involving Lamar Jackson
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The Baltimore Ravens have been fined $100,000 by the NFL for incorrectly listing star quarterback Lamar Jackson as a full participant in practice on Oct. 24. The league disclosed the fine for violating the injury report policy Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Warriors center Trayce Jackson-Davis, in best shape of his life, returns to home state
item.description: Trayce Jackson-Davis was Indiana's boys high school basketball player of the year and also starred collegiately at Indiana.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Dycus, The Mercury News

item.title: George Springer drives in Toronto's lone run as he returns for World Series Game 6 against Dodgers
item.description: George Springer hit an RBI single for the Blue Jays’ lone run in Game 6 of the World Series on Friday night, making an impact after missing two games with an injury to his right side in Toronto’s 3-1 loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers.
item.dc:creator: Rob Gillies, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Prep spotlight: Former Mitty star Aaron Gordon takes game to must-watch level
item.description: San Ramon Valley freshman volleyball standout is the daughter of Cal's co-defensive coordinator. St. Francis inducts latest Hall of Fame class.
item.dc:creator: Christian Babcock, The Mercury News

item.title: Early knockout: Los Gatos scores TDs on its first two plays, routs M-A
item.description: Los Gatos rolls past Menlo-Atherton to improve to 4-0 in Peninsula Athletic League Bay Division play.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Reeves, The Mercury News

item.title: Jake Paul discusses legitimacy of Tank Davis fight, legal threats to critics, and fiancée’s Olympic hopes
item.description: Jake Paul spoke with Fox News Digital about his upcoming bout against Tank Davis, legal threats against critics and his engagement to someone with similar athletic goals.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trey Hendrickson, Breece Hall among biggest names who could be moved before the NFL's trade deadline
item.description: Christian McCaffrey, Roquan Smith and Von Miller were the best trade deadline acquisitions over the past four years. NFL teams looking to bolster their playoff hopes for a run at the Super Bowl have until 4 p.m. ET on Tuesday to make a trade. Of course, it takes two to make a deal.
item.dc:creator: ROB MAADDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Foot note in the outfield: Toronto's Davis Schneider skips shoes a day before playing for title
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A day before playing for a World Series title, Davis Schneider went barefoot in the park. Toronto players arrived at Rogers Centre at about 8 a.m. Thursday after a red-eye flight from Los Angeles that followed their 6-1 win over the Dodgers.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Grand Junction advances in Colorado boys' soccer state tournament
item.description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. (KREX) — Grand Junction beats Liberty 4-0 to advance past the first round of the state playoffs. The Tigers' soccer team keeps rolling after an undefeated season. The Tigers opened the scoring 1:08 into the first half.
item.dc:creator: Jackson Cowen, KREX 5

item.title: Guerrero homers off Ohtani as Blue Jays even World Series with 6-2 win over Dodgers in Game 4
item.description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a two-run homer off Shohei Ohtani in the third inning, Shane Bieber pitched four-hit ball into the sixth, and the Toronto Blue Jays got back on track with a 6-2 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 4 of the World Series on Tuesday night at Dodger Stadium.
item.dc:creator: GREG BEACHAM, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Questionable officiating outshines Bucs win in New Orleans
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers left New Orleans with a dominant 23-3 victory over the Saints, but a pair of questionable calls by NFL officials kept it from being even worse for the home team.
item.dc:creator: Garrett Phillips, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Markkanen scores 51 as Jazz beat Suns in overtime, 138-134
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4 Sports) - Lauri Markkanen scored a career-high 51 points, the first Jazz player to reach 50 in the regular season since Karl Malone in 1998, and Utah beat the Phoenix Suns 138-134 in overtime on Monday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Fan at Penguins game hospitalized after falling from upper concourse
item.description: PITTSBURGH (AP) — A fan at Monday night's game between the Pittsburgh Penguins and St. Louis Blues was taken to a hospital after falling from the upper concourse at PPG Paints Arena. The incident happened early in the first period after Anthony Mantha's goal gave the Penguins a 2-0 lead.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Catching, running and stopping the football: 3 Takeaways from the Bears' loss in Baltimore
item.description: The Chicago Bears' offense struggled against the Ravens, but Rome Odunze was a bright spot, while the defense was unable to rely on turnovers to win, and D'Andre Swift needs to find success running inside the tackles to contribute to winning football games.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Laferriere and Fiala score in 2nd-period burst to back Forsberg in Kings' 3-1 win over Blackhawks
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Alex Laferriere and Kevin Fiala scored in a 1:25 span early in the second period, Anton Forsberg stopped 22 shots and the Los Angeles Kings beat the Chicago Blackhawks 3-1 on Sunday night Coming off a 5-4 shootout loss Saturday night in Nashville, the Kings ended a string of four extr
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: ESPN's 'College Gameday' set to return to the University of Utah ahead of major Big 12 clash
item.description: ESPN announced the return of "College Gameday," the network's weekly, traveling college football pregame show, to the University of Utah's campus ahead of the Utes' pivotal conference matchup against the Cincinnati Bearcats Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Nick Butts, ABC 4

item.title: Winning now or peaking at the Olympics? How World Cup skiers plan to be at their best in February
item.description: While the annual five-month-long World Cup campaign is generally regarded by skiers as their most important stage, the chance to compete for Olympic medals comes along only once every four years.
item.dc:creator: ERIC WILLEMSEN, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Mistake-prone Bears stumble in Baltimore, fumble opportunity to steal road victory at Ravens
item.description: BALTIMORE, Md. (WGN) — As it is often said, the NFL is a week-to-week league. And after five weeks of building positive momentum, the Chicago Bears took a step back in a loss at the Baltimore Ravens on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Bears vs. Ravens: Injuries, inactives and key matchups for Sunday's game in Baltimore
item.description: Sometimes, the major headline leading into an NFL game is up for debate. Other times, it's obvious. This would be a case of the latter. The big news for Sunday's Bears vs.
item.dc:creator: Michael Johnson, WGN 9

item.title: Utes trounce Colorado behind Ficklin's career night, 53-7
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4 Sports) - Byrd is the word. Freshman Byrd Ficklin passed for two touchdowns and ran for another in his first career start to lead Utah to a 53-7 win over Colorado on Saturday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4
